problem:
How long is a soccer field?
0) 370 miles 1) 370 yards 2) 370 feet 3) 370 inches

What is the volume of a paper drinking cup?
0) 115 liters 1) 115 milliliters

Which figure of speech is used in this text?
Mr. Wolfsheim, forgetting the more sentimental atmosphere of the old Metropole, began to eat with ferocious delicacy.
—F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Great Gatsby
0) oxymoron 1) anaphora

Which type of sentence is this?
Brenna is a competitive horseback rider, and she will be competing in the next World Equestrian Games, which are held every four years.
0) compound 1) complex 2) compound-complex 3) simple

What do these two changes have in common?
mixing sand and water
sediment settling to the bottom of a muddy puddle
0) Both are chemical changes. 1) Both are caused by heating. 2) Both are caused by cooling. 3) Both are only physical changes.

Based on this information, what is Hobbes's genotype for the fur type gene?
0) straight fur 1) FF

Which sentence uses a metaphor?
0) The bare tree's branches were sharp needles. 1) The bare tree's branches were as sharp as needles.

Which word would you find on a dictionary page with the following guide words?
bookcase - burden
0) beware 1) brilliant

Is the following trait inherited or acquired?
Anthony has five toes on each foot.
0) inherited 1) acquired

Select the mixture.
0) caramel corn 1) silver

Using only these supplies, which question can Carla investigate with an experiment?
0) Do the deer eat fewer leaves from bean plants sprayed with coffee spray than from unsprayed bean plants? 1) Do the deer eat fewer leaves from bean plants sprayed with garlic spray than from unsprayed bean plants? 2) Do the deer eat more leaves from tomato plants or from squash plants?

Compare the motion of three bicycles. Which bicycle was moving at the highest speed?
0) a bicycle that moved 30miles east in 5hours 1) a bicycle that moved 70miles west in 5hours 2) a bicycle that moved 35miles east in 5hours

Select the one animal that has all of the amphibian traits listed above.
0) Smooth newts have moist, smooth skin with black spots. Young smooth newts hatch from eggs without shells. They live in streams or ponds until they are about ten weeks old. Then, they crawl onto land. 1) Loggerhead sea turtles hatch from eggs with shells. They live in the water, but they lay their eggs on the land. Their scaly, waterproof skin and thick shell help protect them from predators.

Using only these supplies, which question can Cassie investigate with an experiment?
0) Do apple slices dipped in orange juice turn brown more slowly than plain apple slices? 1) Do apple slices turn brown more quickly if they are dipped in sugar or in orange juice? 2) Do slices of pear turn brown more quickly than slices of banana?

At the museum, we saw statues from China.
0) declarative 1) exclamatory

What is the source of the allusion in the sentence below?

0) literature 1) a song

Which logical fallacy is used in the text?
Edna never lies. She told me herself, so it must be true.
0) circular reasoning: an argument that supports a claim with the claim itself 1) straw man: a misrepresentation of an opponent's position that makes it easier to argue against

0) short fur 1) FF

The gravitational potential energy stored between Joseph and Earth () as he hiked toward the summit.
0) increased 1) stayed the same 2) decreased

0) present tense 1) future tense 2) past tense

warm summers and warm winters
a rainy season and a dry season
soil that is poor in nutrients 1) This ecosystem has:
year-round rain and warm temperatures
soil that is poor in nutrients
many different types of organisms 2) This ecosystem has:
long, cold winters and short, cool summers
many evergreen trees

0) straw man: a misrepresentation of an opponent's position that makes it easier to argue against 1) appeal to nature: the assumption that natural things are always good 2) bandwagon fallacy: the assumption that the popular choice is automatically correct

0) Marcy thinks the storm will cause major flooding. 1) Marcy wants to protect her possessions.

Barbara should either stop reading those sappy paranormal romance novels or finally admit that she doesn't believe in empowering women.
0) false dichotomy: an argument that presents only two choices when more options exist 1) guilt by association: a negative association intended to discredit someone or something 2) circular reasoning: an argument that supports a claim with the claim itself

0) auction 1) afraid

What is the source of the allusion in the sentence below?
Isabella had her fifteen minutes when her video of kayaking with dolphins went viral.
0) Greek history 1) modern history

Which correctly shows the title of an article?
0) "Caring for Our Children" 1) Caring for Our Children

Which logical fallacy is used in the text?
In this election, we've seen the highest voter turnout ever recorded. If you have any doubts about Brad Lloyd's qualifications, just look at how many people have come out to vote for him.
0) bandwagon fallacy: the assumption that the popular choice is automatically correct 1) red herring: the use of a completely unrelated topic or idea

What kind of sentence is this?
Maureen felt intimidated by the steep cliff that she faced on her first rock-climbing adventure.
0) exclamatory 1) declarative 2) interrogative

Compare the motion of three ducks. Which duck was moving at the highest speed?
0) a duck that moved 175miles west in 5hours 1) a duck that moved 220miles east in 5hours 2) a duck that moved 260miles north in 5hours

Select the solid.
0) clothespin 1) wet paint 2) grape juice

What information supports the conclusion that Matt acquired this trait?
0) Matt is most interested in human biology. 1) Matt learned biology by reading, observing, and experimenting.

Is the following trait inherited or acquired?
Liam has a scar on his right elbow.
0) acquired 1) inherited

Last year, there were seven men's clothing stores on Main Street in Norwood. This year, there are only three. What probably happened to the overall supply of men's shirts in Norwood?
0) The supply probably went up. 1) The supply probably went down.

Is fixing a sink a good or a service?
0) a good 1) a service

Which logical fallacy is used in the text?
Mr. Kemp argues that we need to do more to prevent workplace injuries and fatalities. I doubt that someone so socially awkward would know a thing about office safety.
0) ad hominem: a personal attack against one's opponent 1) bandwagon fallacy: the assumption that the popular choice is automatically correct

Which word would you find on a dictionary page with the following guide words?
feather - fling
0) fabulous 1) fix

Based on this information, what is Sushi's phenotype for the body color trait?
0) a golden body 1) bb

Which figure of speech is used in this text?
Jayce's leaving his job? That's old news. He's been planning that for months.
0) euphemism 1) oxymoron

Select the animal.
0) Moles eat insects and worms. 1) Cedar trees have small leaves.

Which logical fallacy is used in the text?
You may be impressed by Senator Larsen's work with low-income communities, but the fact remains that he graduated from an elite university. He couldn't possibly empathize with low-income constituents.
0) guilt by association: a negative association intended to discredit someone or something 1) circular reasoning: an argument that supports a claim with the claim itself 2) slippery slope fallacy: the false assumption that a small first step will lead to extreme consequences

Which change best matches the sentence?
Melted rock comes out of a gap in Earth's surface.
0) wildfire 1) volcanic eruption 2) erosion

Which logical fallacy is used in the text?
Nuclear weapons are a threat to the stability and safety of the world. Like nuclear weapons, nuclear power plants rely on fission. Therefore, nuclear power plants are also a threat to the stability and safety of the world.
0) circular reasoning: an argument that supports a claim with the claim itself 1) guilt by association: a negative association intended to discredit someone or something 2) straw man: a misrepresentation of an opponent's position that makes it easier to argue against

What is the temperature of the air on a warm, sunny day?
0) 26°C 1) 26°F

Which logical fallacy is used in the text?
I believe everyone has his or her own idea of what's beautiful in the world. After all, it's the individual who determines what's attractive according to his or her own opinion.
0) circular reasoning: an argument that supports a claim with the claim itself 1) hasty generalization: a broad claim based on too few observations 2) straw man: a misrepresentation of an opponent's position that makes it easier to argue against

Read the following excerpt from a student essay. How can the writer best improve his or her grammar and mechanics?
When I'm asked to name my favorite teacher, I immediately think of Mr. Sweeney. In fifth grade, Mr. Sweeney taught us all about architecture he had the class start by learning to measure things very accurately. We studied environmentally friendly building methods, and we designed and built our own homes of the future. Mr. Sweeney was always fun and interesting, he believed that we could do more than we thought we could do. He helped me break boundaries in my life, he was a positive influence on me and will always be one of the most inspirational people in my life.
0) by using correct verb tenses 1) by fixing run-on sentences

According to Newton's third law, what other force must be happening?
0) The paper clip is pulling on the fridge magnet. 1) The paper clip is pushing on the fridge magnet.

Which mug of cocoa has a higher temperature?
0) the mug of cocoa with less thermal energy 1) the mug of cocoa with more thermal energy

book - bulletin
0) back 1) brave

Which figure of speech is used in this text?
Eric remarked that the new book on anti-gravity was impossible to put down.
0) pun 1) alliteration

What information supports the conclusion that Mike inherited this trait?
0) Mike has freckles on his nose and shoulders. 1) Mike and his biological mother have pale skin. 2) Mike's biological parents have freckles on their noses just as Mike does.

Which is a run-on sentence?
0) Susan's bedroom is neat she puts everything away. 1) The little boy popped a big bubble.
